intro: Narcissus pseudonarcissus var. maximus, commonly known as the Giant Crowned narcissus, is a variant of the Crowned narcissus with larger, more showy flowers. It features a single, large white bloom with a distinctive yellow corona, which is a characteristic feature of the narcissus genus. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with strap-like, grassy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in woodland edges and gardens. This variety is prized for its striking appearance and is a popular choice for ornamental planting.
